intro: Verbascum turcomanicum, commonly known as the Turkestan mullein, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are broad and lobed, often covered in a dense layer of soft, velvety hairs. Verbascum turcomanicum is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its striking appearance and resilience.
